means: 使浮起( buoy的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They are buoyed up by a sense of hope.
In May they danced in the streets, buoyed by their victory.
sentence.Network_cn: 5月里，他们在大街上载歌载舞，欢庆胜利。

sentence.Network_en: Buoyed by their win yesterday the team feel confident of further success.
sentence.Network_cn: 在昨天胜利的鼓舞下，该队有信心再次获胜。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语反义词 - 豆丁网 ... bungle 失败>大成功 buoyed 支撑的>没有支持的 burgeoning 迅速生长的>慢慢衰减的.
we felt buoyed up by the good news ., 我们觉得这个好消息很令人鼓舞.
buoyboat 设标船, buoyed 浮标水听器, buoydues 浮筒费
That was an economy buoyed up by the new development of industry ., 那是一种受到工业新发展所支持的经济.

entry.def: A buoy is a floating object that is used to show ships and boats where they can go and to warn them of danger.
If someone in a difficult situation is buoyed by something, it makes them feel more cheerful and optimistic.

example.ex: In May they danced in the streets, buoyed by their victory...
example.tran: 5月里，他们在大街上载歌载舞，欢庆胜利。

example.ex: German domestic consumption buoyed the German economy.
example.tran: 德国的国内消费刺激了德国经济。

auth_sentence.content: Predictably, the economic optimism buoyed copper and crude.
auth_sentence.res_content: Predictably, the economic optimism buoyed copper and crude.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Predictably, the economic optimism buoyed copper and crude.

auth_sentence.content: Morgan Stanley and General Electric buoyed shares with better-than-expected earnings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Morgan Stanley and General Electric buoyed shares with better-than-expected earnings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Morgan Stanley and General Electric buoyed shares with better-than-expected earnings.

auth_sentence.content: Nigel Farage's party will undoubtedly be buoyed by their increasing popularity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nigel Farage's party will undoubtedly be buoyed by their increasing popularity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nigel Farage's party will undoubtedly be buoyed by their increasing popularity.
